post_text: Update: Our Meagher County number of active cases dropped to 3 today, so we are back to our original PPE requirements.

post_text: The White Sulphur Springs School Board of Trustees met today to address the District's policies on fans for both volleyball and football for the 2020 season. The following is the result of that meeting.
text: The White Sulphur Springs School Board of Trustees met today to address the District's policies on fans for both volleyball and football for the 2020 season. The following is the result of that meeting.

post_text: Just as a reminder to all staff, students and parents, now that we are above 4 active cases in the county, we fall under the Governor's directive for facial coverings. That means that everyone in the school is required to wear facial coverings. It also means that the desk shields that we were using to give people a break from the facial coverings will no longer count as PPE. All people in the school will be be required to wear facial coverings any time they can not social distance (at least 6 feet) even if they have a desk shield. This will not change the P.E. and athletics requirements that if they are engaged in strenuous physical activity, they do not need a mask.
text: Just as a reminder to all staff, students and parents, now that we are above 4 active cases in the county, we fall under the Governor's directive for facial coverings. That means that everyone in the school is required to wear facial coverings. It also means that the desk shields that we were using to give people a break from the facial coverings will no longer count as PPE. All people in the school will be be required to wear facial coverings any time they can not social distance (at least 6 feet) even if they have a desk shield. This will not change the P.E. and athletics requirements that if they are engaged in strenuous physical activity, they do not need a mask.

White Sulphur Springs Graduation Commencement and 8th Grade Promotion will be held on Sunday, May 17th @ 2:00pm on the football field. This is a private event for the families of the participants to attended. Those wishing to watch the event may do so on the White Sulphur Springs School District Facebook Live starting @ 2:00pm. It will also be broadcasted through station 93.5

The senior slide show can be viewed with this link: https://youtu.be/0hkGb_glv3g
and will be kept open for viewing until May 21st.

GOVERNOR STEVE BULLOCK

CONTACTS:

Marissa Perry, Communications Director, Governor‚Äôs Office, (406) 444-4514

Erin Loranger, Press Secretary, Governor‚Äôs Office, (406) 444-9725

Governor Bullock to Host Press Call to Extend Directives, Announce Measures to Protect First Responders and Support Local Governments

HELENA ‚Äì Today at 2:00 p.m., Governor Steve Bullock will host a press call to extend directives and announce measures to protect first responders and support local governments.

Who: Governor Steve Bullock

What: Press call on COVID-19

When: Tuesday, April 7, 2020 at 2:00 PM

Reporters will be provided with the call-in information 15 minutes before the call. The press conference will be streamed live on the Montana Public Affairs Network Facebook page.

post_text:
In anticipation that the school closures continue beyond April 10th, the White Sulphur Springs School Food Service will provide an opportunity for families to receive, at the regular cost, delivery of breakfast and lunch meals for students and staff. Meals are mostly grab and go style.

(See photo for pricing)

To sign up for this service please send an e-mail to the Maureen Brewer mbrewer@whitesulphur.k12.mt.us before 3:00 pm April 7th. Even if you are currently receiving meals you must send this e-mail to continue.
Meal delivery will start on Tuesday, April 14th. A daily delivery schedule will be developed as people sign up. In an effort to keep things simple, when you sign up you will receive and be charged for both breakfast and lunch on a daily basis until you contact the District office and are removed from the list.

You will be contacted when the balance in your account gets low.

Once again, please get signed up before 3:00 pm April 7th as that will allow us to plan our orders.
text:

To sign up for this service please send an e-mail to the Maureen Brewer mbrewer@whitesulphur.k12.mt.us before 3:00 pm April 7th. Even if you are currently receiving meals you must send this e-mail to continue.
Meal delivery will start on Tuesday, April 14th. A daily delivery schedule will be developed as people sign up. In an effort to keep things simple, when you sign up you will receive and be charged for both breakfast and lunch on a daily basis until you contact the District office and are removed from the list.

You will be contacted when the balance in your account gets low.

Once again, please get signed up before 3:00 pm April 7th as that will allow us to plan our orders.

post_text:
March 19, 2020 IMPORTANT NOTIFICATION!!!

Students/parents will be allowed to come to the school to pick up work, materials etc. Students should be checking online with their teachers. This is no longer optional, it is MANDATORY.

Elementary and JH students-please come to the school at 2:00 today and pick up your music instruments. We are open in office if you can‚Äôt do it then, but today is more recommended.

K-12 online schooling is moved from supplemental to MANDATORY. Check your emails, teacher web pages, and your child‚Äôs teacher will be in contact with you via phone or email/internet.

K-12 teachers will make contact with student/families, regarding mandatory school work. Check website for additional information this afternoon.
.

K-12 assignments are mandatory.K-6 Additional materials for grades 1st, 3rd, 4th & 5th will be available for pick-up at 2:00.

post_text:
Mandatory Junior High & Elementary Boys Winter Sports Parent Meeting
The Winter sports parent meetings for Junior High and Elementary Boys Basketball will be held on Tuesday, December 10th at 6:00 pm in the Multi-purpose gym. This is a mandatory meeting and at least one parent of each athlete must attend for your child to be eligible to participate in the activity. These meetings are an important way for coaches to open the lines of communication with parents, and to relay season expectations to parents and participants. This meeting is for Junior High and Elementary Boys Basketball players and their parents.

post_text:
Mandatory Winter Sports Parent Meeting
The Winter sports parent meetings will be held on Tuesday, November 12th at 6:00 pm in the high school gym. This is a mandatory meeting and at least one parent of each athlete must attend for your child to be eligible to participate in the activity. These meetings are an important way for coaches to open the lines of communication with parents, and to relay season expectations to parents and participants. This meeting is for High School Basketball (both Girls and Boys), Cheerleading, and Wrestling. We will be having a JH Boys basketball meeting in December.
text:
Mandatory Winter Sports Parent Meeting
The Winter sports parent meetings will be held on Tuesday, November 12th at 6:00 pm in the high school gym. This is a mandatory meeting and at least one parent of each athlete must attend for your child to be eligible to participate in the activity. These meetings are an important way for coaches to open the lines of communication with parents, and to relay season expectations to parents and participants. This meeting is for High School Basketball (both Girls and Boys), Cheerleading, and Wrestling. We will be having a JH Boys basketball meeting in December.

post_text: White Sulphur School District would like to congratulate Miss. Hurley as she has been selected to receive a Presidential Award for Excellence in Mathematics and Science Teaching. The PAEMST program, administered by the National Science Foundation (NSF) on behalf of the White House Office of Science and Technology Policy recognizes outstanding teachers for their contributions to the teaching and learning of science, technology, engineering, mathematics, and/or computer science.
text: White Sulphur School District would like to congratulate Miss. Hurley as she has been selected to receive a Presidential Award for Excellence in Mathematics and Science Teaching. The PAEMST program, administered by the National Science Foundation (NSF) on behalf of the White House Office of Science and Technology Policy recognizes outstanding teachers for their contributions to the teaching and learning of science, technology, engineering, mathematics, and/or computer science.

post_text:
Parents, Staff, and Community;

White Sulphur Springs School experienced a social media threat late last night. We appreciate the cooperation of all involved in keeping our students and staff safe. The police in both Meagher and Lewis & Clark counties have been investigating the threat and have determined that the threat is no longer viable. The individual responsible for the posts on social media has been identified and law enforcement is handling the situation. The threat originated in Helena and law enforcement there is working with the individual responsible.
Again, we want to thank everyone involved and we look forward to seeing our students and staff on Tuesday.

White Sulphur Springs School Administration
text:
Parents, Staff, and Community;

White Sulphur Springs School experienced a social media threat late last night. We appreciate the cooperation of all involved in keeping our students and staff safe. The police in both Meagher and Lewis & Clark counties have been investigating the threat and have determined that the threat is no longer viable. The individual responsible for the posts on social media has been identified and law enforcement is handling the situation. The threat originated in Helena and law enforcement there is working with the individual responsible.
Again, we want to thank everyone involved and we look forward to seeing our students and staff on Tuesday.

White Sulphur Springs School Administration

post_text:
Due to a social media threat detected late on October 22nd, White Sulphur Springs School will be cancelling all classes on Monday, October 23rd to allow for a more complete investigation. This is a precaution to ensure the safety of our students and staff. Parents and staff please comment on this post so that we know you got the message.
White Sulphur Springs School Administration

post_text:
Traffic Education 2018
There will two options for the mandatory parent/student meeting for Traffic Education this year:
1st-Thursday, March 15th from 4:00-6:00 p.m.
2nd-Sunday, March 25th from 4:00-6:00 p.m.
Please bring the following items with you to register your child:
*Certified Birth Certificate
*Social Security Card
*Proof of Residency (electric bills work the best)
*Eye Glasses (if applicable)
*Fee-You may pay the $200 fee the day of the meeting, or pay Amy in the high school office before April 3rd. Both meetings are being held in the Jr. High math room (205). For further information, please call Shannon Barrett at 547-3351.

Homecoming Week Schedule
Monday: America Day, Close-Up Burgers @ 6:00pm, Bonfire @ 6:30pm.
Tuesday: Meme/Emoji Day, Powder-Puff Volleyball for grades 9-12, ladies begin @ 6:00pm followed by gentlemen @ 7:00pm.
Wednesday: Black & Orange Day, Float decorating begins at 8:30, Parade on Main Street @ 1:00pm, Early Out 2:30pm
Thursday: Theme Day, Girls leave for Gardiner @ 11:30am.
Friday: Celebrity Day, Pep-Assembly 4/5th hour, Girls leave for Manhattan Christian @ 1:30pm.
Saturday: Football vs. West Yellowstone, junior high begin at 10:00am, varsity begins at 1:00pm. Royalty announced at 1/2 time. Volleyball vs. Sheridan, games start at 3:00pm. Dance for grades 9-12 from 8-10pm.

Phase two renovations of White Sulphur Springs School District K-12 building continue to progress nicely.
text:
CWG Architecture, Engineering & Design
April 4, 2017 at 11:53 AM ¬∑ White Sulphur Springs, MT ¬∑

Phase two renovations of White Sulphur Springs School District K-12 building continue to progress nicely.

post_text:
Message from CWG Architect Tony Perpignano:

As we transition into phase two of the construction process, we just wanted to report to the community that our team remains on schedule and we have worked very hard to preserve much of your construction contingency. Through the collective efforts of Dick Anderson Construction, CWG and the tireless leadership of Mr. Markuson and the WSS school committee, know that your investment in education is being maximized to the best of our efforts. In the coming months, the walls will begin to take shape and the connection will be made between the new classroom wings and the existing gymnasium. The community of White Sulphur Springs will have much to be proud of. Thank you for allowing us this opportunity.
text:
Message from CWG Architect Tony Perpignano:

As we transition into phase two of the construction process, we just wanted to report to the community that our team remains on schedule and we have worked very hard to preserve much of your construction contingency. Through the collective efforts of Dick Anderson Construction, CWG and the tireless leadership of Mr. Markuson and the WSS school committee, know that your investment in education is being maximized to the best of our efforts. In the coming months, the walls will begin to take shape and the connection will be made between the new classroom wings and the existing gymnasium. The community of White Sulphur Springs will have much to be proud of. Thank you for allowing us this opportunity.

post_text:
We would like everyone to know about the fundraising events for Jeanne's Journey. Mrs. Gilman went in for colon surgery and was diagnosed with ovarian cancer. The following events have been established to help the family cover expenses.
On February 10th and 11th, concessions at the basketball games will be donated to Mrs. Gilman's family. $10 walking taco meal will be served.
On February 12th starting at 4:00 p.m., there will be a fiesta dinner prepared by Michelle Walker and hosted by the Stockman Bar. Join us anytime these nights for some good food and a great cause!
For any questions on these evnts, please call
Margaret Wilhelm at 406-547-3563
Janie Barfuss at 406-547-4016
Jane Townsend at 406-547-4217

post_text: Our rendering is how we imagined the library space would look after it was complete, and Dick Anderson‚Äôs team is making it a full reality. The high ceilings and large windows make the library bright and inviting. We love its balance between fun, interactive elements, and relaxing, classic finishes. We are very happy with the progress and we are excited for the staff and students of White Sulphur Springs to be able to enjoy their new spaces.
text: Our rendering is how we imagined the library space would look after it was complete, and Dick Anderson‚Äôs team is making it a full reality. post_text:
BPA we are having our last "Christmas lunch" in this room. Bitter Sweet! The Christmas Crackers were loaded with the English crowns and the typical corny jokes as well as with their service project for the month. We did a tad bit of history since there was only three students who had ever heard of Christmas Crackers (not the saltines).
Each one was different and then Mrs. Hanson's had the overall club project and we will be putting new American flags into the new classrooms and working with American Legion to take care of the old ones.
text:
BPA we are having our last "Christmas lunch" in this room. Bitter Sweet! The Christmas Crackers were loaded with the English crowns and the typical corny jokes as well as with their service project for the month. We did a tad bit of history since there was only three students who had ever heard of Christmas Crackers (not the saltines).
Each one was different and then Mrs. Hanson's had the overall club project and we will be putting new American flags into the new classrooms and working with American Legion to take care of the old ones.

post_text: National Honor Society members will be dressed up in costumes coming door-to-door Trick-or-Treating on Halloween night from 6pm to 8pm for hygiene products. If able and willing please consider donating the following items: toilet paper, mouth wash, tooth brushes, feminine products, toothpaste, deodorant, and/or shampoo. If you won't be home and want to donate members will be looking for sacks/boxes on porches.

post_text:
Schedule for Tuesday:
We will run a Friday Schedule in the 7-12. Which means that we will have Friday class length for the 1st 4 periods. At the end of 4th period (11:30) the 7-12 will be released for lunch. School will dismiss at 11:50 and bus routes will run at 12:00 noon.

The elementary will run a normal morning but will go to lunch early starting at 11:00. They too will dismiss at 11:50 and buses will run at noon.

The buses to the cemetery are open to anyone! The buses will leave the front of the school for the cemetery at 1:45 tomorrow.
text:
Schedule for Tuesday:
We will run a Friday Schedule in the 7-12. Which means that we will have Friday class length for the 1st 4 periods. At the end of 4th period (11:30) the 7-12 will be released for lunch. School will dismiss at 11:50 and bus routes will run at 12:00 noon.

The elementary will run a normal morning but will go to lunch early starting at 11:00. They too will dismiss at 11:50 and buses will run at noon.

The buses to the cemetery are open to anyone! The buses will leave the front of the school for the cemetery at 1:45 tomorrow.
